definition: villager/(Tw) (Internet slang) person who likes to follow online discussions and add their opinions
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)

sentences.english: He became concerned that many people in the East Lothian countryside did not have access to libraries.
sentences.chinese: 他意識到東洛錫安地區鄉民並沒有利用圖書館。

sentences.english: Ladle with wood, simple production, the peasant villagers must.
sentences.chinese: 馬勺採用樹材，製作簡便，歷代農家鄉民必備。

sentences.english: The honest villagers came from a lonely village.
sentences.chinese: 這些淳樸的鄉民來自於一個偏遠的鄉村。

sentences.english: A gang of arcane spell casters on flying mounts terrorizes the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 一羣騎乘着飛行魔獸的奧術施法者讓鄉民們驚恐不安。

definition: fellow countryman (from the same village)/local people/villager/the folks back home
Pingtung city, county and military airbase in south Taiwan
one after another/in succession/one by one/continuously/diverse/in profusion/numerous and confused/pell-mell
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
